hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
[ "$(echo $VERBOSE | sed 's/,//g')" == false ] && set +x
# Need to get our hands on bash.lib.sh from github. ROOT_DIR="$(echo $ROOT_DIR | sed 's/,//g')" if [ -z "$ROOT_DIR" ] || [ ! -f "$ROOT_DIR/bash.lib.sh" ] ; then GIT_SCRIPT_URL=git@github.com:bu-ist/kuali-research-docker.git GIT_SCRIPT_BRANCH=master CLI=/var/lib/jenkins/jenkins-cli.jar HOST=http://localhost:8080/ source /var/lib/jenkins/cli-credentials.sh java -jar ${CLI} -s ${HOST} build 'kuali-core-1-pull-build-scripts' -v -f \ -p GIT_REPO_URL=${GIT_SCRIPT_URL} \ -p GIT_BRANCH=${GIT_SCRIPT_BRANCH} \ -p ROOT_DIR=${WORKSPACE} [ ! -f "${WORKSPACE}/bash.lib.sh" ] && echo "ERROR! Cannot get bash.lib.sh from github!" && exit 1 source "${WORKSPACE}/bash.lib.sh" else # Content was already pulled by another job that is calling this job, so we need to source the script from the other jobs workspace. source "$ROOT_DIR/bash.lib.sh" fi
# Fix the trailing comma issue with active choices parameters reactive VERBOSE="$(echo $VERBOSE | sed 's/,//g')" BLAST_IMAGE="$(echo $BLAST_IMAGE | sed 's/,//g')" GIT_REPO_URL="$(echo $GIT_REPO_URL | sed 's/,//g')" GIT_BRANCH="$(echo $GIT_BRANCH | sed 's/,//g')" EC2_INSTANCE_ID="$(echo $EC2_INSTANCE_ID | sed 's/,//g')" LANDSCAPE="$(echo $LANDSCAPE | sed 's/,//g')" DOCKER_IMAGE="$(echo $DOCKER_IMAGE | sed 's/,//g')"
# Validate the job parameters [ -z "$GIT_REPO_URL" ] && echo "ERROR! GIT_REPO_URL cannot be empty!" && exit 1 [ -z "$GIT_BRANCH" ] && echo "ERROR! GIT_BRANCH cannot be empty!" && exit 1 [ -z "$EC2_INSTANCE_ID" ] && echo "ERROR! EC2_INSTANCE_ID cannot be empty!" && exit 1 [ -z "$LANDSCAPE" ] && echo "ERROR! LANDSCAPE cannot be empty!" && exit 1 [ -z "$DOCKER_IMAGE" ] && echo "ERROR! DOCKER_IMAGE cannot be empty!" && exit 1
# Create an array of parameters to pass to the runapp function (see below). parms=( "\"run\"" "\"$LANDSCAPE\"" "\"$DOCKER_IMAGE\"" "\"$BLAST_IMAGE\"" )
# Compose the code that is to be passed as a command with the ssm send-command call # # NOTE: Have to encode the command being sent to ssm agent because of quote escaping restrictions. # (jenkins removes double quotes and escapes single quotes and wraps command args with more single # quotes if they contain spaces, making it impossible to provide a string that is acceptable to send-command commands arg) GIT_ROOT="/opt/kuali-research-docker" BASE64=$(\ echo \ "set +x && echo '#################################################################################'; \ echo '###### 1) Obtaining the private key to get the docker build context from git'; \ echo '#################################################################################' && set -x; \ export AWS_DEFAULT_REGION=us-east-1; \ export AWS_DEFAULT_OUTPUT=json; \ if [ ! -f ~/.ssh/bu_github_id_docker_rsa ] ; then \ [ -n \"\$(aws help 1> /dev/null)\" ] && echo 'ERROR! The aws cli does not seem to be installed!' && exit 1; \ aws s3 cp s3://kuali-research-ec2-setup/bu_github_id_docker_rsa ~/.ssh ; \ if [ ! -f ~/.ssh/bu_github_id_docker_rsa ] ; then \ echo 'ERROR! Cannot obtain private key bu_github_id_docker_rsa'; \ exit 1; \ fi; \ chmod 600 ~/.ssh/bu_github_id_docker_rsa; \ ssh-keyscan -t rsa github.com >> ~/.ssh/known_hosts; \ fi; \ set +x && echo '#################################################################################'; \ echo '###### 2) Checking/preparing git configuration for pull of docker build context'; \ echo '#################################################################################' && set -x; \ [ ! -d ${GIT_ROOT} ] && mkdir ${GIT_ROOT}; \ cd ${GIT_ROOT}; \ if [ ! -d .git ] ; then \ git init; \ fi; \ if [ -z \"\$(git config --get remote.github.url)\" ] ; then \ git config user.email jenkins@bu.edu; \ git config user.name jenkins; \ git remote add github ${GIT_REPO_URL}; \ fi; \ eval \"ssh-agent -k\" || true; \ eval \"\$(ssh-agent -s)\"; \ ssh-add ~/.ssh/bu_github_id_docker_rsa; \ set +x && echo '#################################################################################'; \ echo '###### 3) Fetching docker build context from git'; \ echo '#################################################################################' && set -x; \ git fetch github ${GIT_BRANCH}; \ currentbranch=\"\$(git rev-parse --abbrev-ref HEAD)\"; \ if [ \"\$currentbranch\" != \"${GIT_BRANCH}\" ] ; then \ git commit -a -m \"Saving work on \$currentbranch before checking out $GIT_BRANCH\"; \ fi; \ if [ -n \"\$(git rev-parse --verify ${GIT_BRANCH} 2>/dev/null)\" ] ; then \ [ \"\$currentbranch\" != \"${GIT_BRANCH}\" ] && git checkout ${GIT_BRANCH}; \ git reset --hard FETCH_HEAD; \ else \ git checkout -b ${GIT_BRANCH} remotes/github/${GIT_BRANCH}; \ fi; \ eval \"ssh-agent -k\" || true; \ set +x && echo '#################################################################################'; \ echo '###### 4) Running docker run command...'; \ echo '#################################################################################' && set -x; \ cd $GIT_ROOT/research-pdf/build.context; \ if [ -f docker.pdf.run.sh ] ; then \ cat docker.pdf.run.sh > docker.pdf.run.last.sh; \ fi; \ if [ "$VERBOSE" == false ] ; then \ sh docker.sh ${parms[@]} 2>&1 | tee /tmp/last-pdf-run-cmd; \ else \ sh -x docker.sh ${parms[@]} 2>&1 | tee /tmp/last-pdf-run-cmd; \ fi; \ if [ -f docker.pdf.run.sh ] ; then \ sh docker.pdf.run.sh; \ else \ echo 'ERROR! Failed to generate docker.pdf.run.sh'; \ exit 1; \ fi;" | base64 -w 0 \ ) echo "BASE64 = $BASE64" echo "EC2_INSTANCE_ID = $EC2_INSTANCE_ID"
# Execute the send-command call COMMAND_ID=$(aws ssm send-command \ --instance-ids "${EC2_INSTANCE_ID}" \ --document-name "AWS-RunShellScript" \ --comment "Running shell script to pull and run container against a new docker image for ${REGISTRY_REPO_NAME}" \ --parameters \ commands="echo >> /tmp/ssm-pdf-received && date >> /tmp/ssm-pdf-received && \ echo ${BASE64} | base64 --decode >> /tmp/ssm-pdf-received && \ echo ${BASE64} | base64 --decode > /tmp/ssm-pdf-last.sh && \ echo ${BASE64} | base64 --decode | sh 2>&1" \ --output text \ --query "Command.CommandId" \ --output-s3-bucket-name "kuali-docker-run-stdout" \ --output-s3-key-prefix "pdf")
# The file output by ssm send-command won't be available in s3 immediately, so # making repeated attempts to access it in a loop until it is available. echo "COMMAND_ID=$COMMAND_ID" i=1 while ((i<100)) ; do s3Url="$(s3GetPdfSendCommandOutputFileUrl $COMMAND_ID)" [ -n "$s3Url" ] && echo "Url to presign is: $s3Url" && break; echo "Url to presign not ready. Trying again in 3 seconds..." ((i+=1)) sleep 3 done
if [ -n "$s3Url" ] ; then # Have the s3 url of the stdout file presigned so a we can access it with a new url that will get around # the private access restriction. days=7 seconds="$((60*60*24*${days}))" httpUrl="$(aws s3 presign "${s3Url}" --expires-in=${seconds})" echo "Access the docker container creation output on the remote EC2 instance (${EC2_INSTANCE_ID}) at:" echo " " echo "$httpUrl" echo " " echo "You may have to wait for about a minute for the link to become available" echo "(link expires in $days days)" echo " " else echo "WARNING! Could not acquire s3 location of ssm send-command output file!" echo "You will have to shell into the ec2 instance and open /tmp/last-pdf-run-cmd to determine how it went." fi
